newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Korea Zinc to sell 200,000 shares.
newsitem.headline: Korea Zinc to sell 200,000 shares.

text.p: Korea Zinc Co Ltd, a zinc smelter, said on Friday it will sell 200,000 of its own common shares to raise working capital.
After the sell-off, the company will not hold any of its own shares.
The share sale, representing 1.16 percent of the company's share capital, will take place between October 22 and January 21, a company statement said.
The statement said the shares would be sold on the open market at the previous day's closing price. Dongsuh Securities will handle the selloff.
Korea Zinc's shares closed Friday down 500 won at 18,900.
